lines.content: # Hello, I'm Duke, Your Personal Task Manager
I am capable of managing tasks that you need to keep track of.
Create a new task that can be a to-do, a deadline or an event. The
new task will be added to my task list.
List the tasks that I currently have in my tasklist.
Once you have finished a task I can mark it as completed.
If you want to unmark a previously completed task, it can be updated.
Delete an existing task from the task list.
Find an existing task from the task list using a search keyword.
All suitable matches will be listed.
Automatically updates the data file to store changes made to a task list.
All tasks can be restored at the start of a new session.
1. Download the JAR file from the repository's release page.
2. Create a new folder and transfer Duke.jar into it.
3. From terminal navigate to the new folder.
Creates a new task that is a todo.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
A new todo has been added to Duke's task list.
Creates a new task that is a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
A new deadline has been added to Duke's task list, with a due date of 23/02/2022
Creates a new task that is an event.
| ```<eventTime> ```| Time that the event is scheduled for|
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
A new event has been added to Duke's task list, with the specified event time.
Lists all the tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
| ```<task index> ```| The numerical index of the task to be marked|
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmarks a task that was previously marked as completed.
| ```<task index> ```| The numerical index of the task to be unmarked|
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes a task from the task list.
| ```<task index> ```| The numerical index of the task to be deleted|
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Searches for task(s) that match the search from the task list.
| ```<search query> ```| The keyword used to search for matching task(s)|
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Stops the Duke application and saves the tasks for a future session.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
# Hello, I'm Duke, Your Personal Task Manager
I am capable of managing tasks that you need to keep track of.
Create a new task that can be a to-do, a deadline or an event. The
new task will be added to my task list.
List the tasks that I currently have in my tasklist.
Once you have finished a task I can mark it as completed.
If you want to unmark a previously completed task, it can be updated.
Delete an existing task from the task list.
Find an existing task from the task list using a search keyword.
All suitable matches will be listed.
Automatically updates the data file to store changes made to a task list.
All tasks can be restored at the start of a new session.
1. Download the JAR file from the repository's release page.
2. Create a new folder and transfer Duke.jar into it.
3. From terminal navigate to the new folder.
Creates a new task that is a todo.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
A new todo has been added to Duke's task list.
Creates a new task that is a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
A new deadline has been added to Duke's task list, with a due date of 23/02/2022
Creates a new task that is an event.
| ```<eventTime> ```| Time that the event is scheduled for|
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
A new event has been added to Duke's task list, with the specified event time.
Lists all the tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
| ```<task index> ```| The numerical index of the task to be marked|
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmarks a task that was previously marked as completed.
| ```<task index> ```| The numerical index of the task to be unmarked|
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes a task from the task list.
| ```<task index> ```| The numerical index of the task to be deleted|
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Searches for task(s) that match the search from the task list.
| ```<search query> ```| The keyword used to search for matching task(s)|
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Stops the Duke application and saves the tasks for a future session.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* Represents a Task of type Deadline. Deadline has task title as well as a string "by" that represents deadline due
* Instead of a string, the due date can also be represented as a date time object "byDate".
* Constructs a Deadline with a title and a string that represents due date.
* @param title Title of the Deadline task.
* @param by Deadline due date that is represented as a string.
* Constructs a Deadline with a title and a datetime object that represents due date.
* @param title Title of the Deadline task.
* @param byDate Deadline due date that is represented as a date time object.
* Gets the string due date of a Deadline.
* @return String that represents due date of a deadline.
* Gets the datetime object that represents due date of a deadline.
* @return Datetime object that represents due date.
* Formats the bydate as a datetime object.
* Optionally datetime object can just include a date without time.
* @return The formatted date time that can be printed.
* Converts the attributes of a Deadline into a string ready to be printed.
* @return String that represents a deadline and its attributes.
* The main class for Duke Task Manager
private static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
* Initializes the different components of Duke such as User Interface, TaskList, Storage
* Starts the Duke Task Manager Application.
* Starts the chatbot where the user can type in commands to interact with Duke.
System.out.println("    Sorry I do not know what that means!");
System.out.println("    Sorry I do not know what that means!");
* Represents a Task of type Event.
* Event tasks contain a description of the task as well as the time of the event that will occur.
* @param title The title of the Event to be created.
* @param eventTime String containing the event time.
* Returns a string that contains the event period.
* Returns a string representation of the Event object and its attributes.
* @return String containing the event and its attributes.
* Parser class that will parse the user input and make sense of it.
* Parses the main input by the user to determine the command that Duke will perform - add, list, delete etc.
* @param input Input string by the user that contains the command along with the task to interact with (optional).
* @return Command parsed from the input string.
* Represents the methods used to access stored data of Duke.
* Reads the data file from directory to create a tasklist.
* If there is no directory or file specified, they will be created.
System.out.println("    I have created \"duke.txt\" to store your tasks: "+dukeFile.getName());
System.out.println("    I have restored your tasks from the last session!");
* Writes into the data file to update the changes from the current task list.
//if deadline date is a string format
* Represents the base class of a task.
* Contains a task title and an isDone attributes.
* Sets a newly created task as not completed yet by default.
* @param title The title of the task that is to be created.
* Gets the isDone attribute of a task.
* Sets the isDone attribute of a task.
* @param done Used to set the isDone attribute
* Gets the task completion status of a task.
* @return String that represents the appropriate characters to denote task completion.
* Converts a task to its string representation of a task and its attributes.
* @return String representation of a task and its attributes.
* Class to contain the list of tasks and methods to interact with the list.
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
* Lists the tasks from the task list.
System.out.println("    Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks a task denoted by its index as complete.
* @param task Input string that contains the mark command and the task index to be marked.
System.out.println("    Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("    Please enter a valid task number");
System.out.println("    OOPS there are no tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    OOPS there are only " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    Please enter the number of the task you want to mark");
* Unmarks a task denoted by its index as complete.
* @param task Input string that contains the unmark command and the task index to be unmarked.
System.out.println("    OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("    Please enter a valid task number");
System.out.println("    OOPS there are no tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    OOPS there are only " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    Please enter the number of the task you want to unmark");
* Deleted a task denoted by its index from the task list.
* @param task Input string that contains the delete command and the task index to be deleted.
System.out.println("    Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have "+taskList.size()+" tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    OOPS there are no tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    OOPS there are only " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("    Please enter the number of the task you want to delete");
* Adds a task to the task list after determining the type of the task.
* @param task Input string that contains the task type and the task desccription.
* @throws DukeException If the task type is present but the task description is empty.
System.out.println("    Sorry I do not know what that means");
System.out.println("    OOPS!!! The description of a task cannot be empty");
System.out.println("    OOPS!!! The description of a " + task + " cannot be empty");
* Adds a task as a Todo class instance.
* @param task Description of the todo that needs to be added.
* Adds a task as an Event class instance.
* @param task Description of the event and the event time that need to be added.
System.out.println("    Please enter a time for your event");
* Adds a task as a Deadline class instance
* @param task Description of the deadline and the deadline date that need to be added.
//if we get a valid date store as a valid date, else store as a string
System.out.println("    Please enter a date for your deadline");
* Extracts the deadline date from the string as a datetime object.
* @param by String that contains the deadline date.
System.out.println("    Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + (taskList.size()) + " tasks in the list.");
* Finds a task from the tasklist specified by a keyword.
* @param taskKeyword Search keyword used to search for a particular task.
System.out.println("    There are no tasks that match \""+taskKeyword+"\"");
* Lists the matches found after a task is searched.
* @param matches Arraylist that contains the matches found for after a search.
System.out.println("    Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a basic todo instance of a task without any extra attributes.
* Creates an instance of a Todo class
* @param title Title of a todo instance
* @return String representation of a todo object and its attributes.
* Represents the user interface of Duke and its methods.
* Prints the logo of Duke Task Manager.
* Prints a line break on the command line.
/** Greets the user at the start and the end of a Duke application run.
* @param greeting String that denotes the type of greeting.
System.out.println("    What can I do for you?\n");
System.out.println("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
